CatDescriptText: Mrs. Carol Chapman, housewife, Elmore Square and Mr. James Smith, taxidriver, Homewood, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 23, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think race relations are improving or worsening in Pittsburgh?" Mrs. Carol Chapman's answer reads: "Improving a little, but it will take more time for a greater improvement.  There has been more improvement in the past 10 years, than there was previously."  Mr. James Smith's answer reads: "Things are a little better, but improvements are not as fast as they should be."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Carol Chapman wearing horizontally striped coat with dark collar and hoop earrings, standing in front of iron fence; Portrait of James Smith wearing dark zippered jacket and People's Cab cap, standing on Fifth Avenue, Downtown
